title: Breaking: Zcash Developers Walk Out (Big Trouble Ahead?)
transcript:
If you are a crypto investor, there are two 
big stories today that you want to talk about.   The first one is the headlines around Zcash 
where their entire development team has left.   The main developers have quit. Those are the 
headlines. If you look at the charts on Zcash,   it has gone down about 20% in the last 24 
hours. The next big headline is tomorrow   because the Supreme Court rules as to whether 
Trump's tariffs were actually legal. If Trump's   tariffs are not illegal, then what is that 
actually going to do to the market? Remember,   tomorrow is Friday and you know what happens 
on Fridays with big news. Today is almost like   a two for the price of one. There is the 
Zcash news and I am going to break it down   for you concisely and slowly. I am going 
to show you whether it is an opportunity   today or whether you should be selling all 
your Zcash. Then we are going to talk about   the Trump tariffs and the Supreme Court ruling 
to decide whether or not it can actually move   markets tomorrow and how you should prepare 
yourself. Let's get the show on the road. Never a dull day if you are a crypto 
investor. If you are still a crypto investor,   let me know in the chat because it feels like 
a lot of crypto investors have left. They have   given up. The sideways chop has knocked 
them down. At some stage, we are going   to have a discussion as to whether we are in 
a bear market or whether there is an uptrend   ahead of us or whether this is just a correction. 
Today is a big day and we need to talk about the   big news of the day and the big news which is 
going to happen tomorrow. The big news of today   undoubtedly is this Zcash story where effectively 
their developers have all just resigned. The big   question here is whether this is true or whether 
this is FUD and whether you should actually be   buying the dip. I am going to break that down 
for you because I have got a lot of inside scoop.   I have spoken to a lot of insiders and I can 
tell you exactly what is going on today and   then we will talk about the Trump tariffs. First 
things first, if you are new to the channel,   subscribe to the channel. Join probably the 
most active community in the world. There are   1.185 million subscribers to the channel. 
Also, help me out by just hitting the like   button because the YouTube algorithm doesn't 
realize that I was away and now I am back,   so it isn't circulating the content as much. 
When you hit the like button, it gives energy to   the algorithm and really helps the distribution 
of the show. I am waiting for the likes, guys. Let's talk about the first stories first. Zcash 
and this morning, investors woke up to these   headlines. Zcash developers quit, form new company 
after board clash. Privacy coin Zcash sinks 20%   after core developer team quits. Zcash's main 
developers walk out without warning. Zcash faces   its biggest test yet. This is what the chart 
looks like. The chart, if we looked at Zcash   two days ago, it was at $500. Now it is 20% down 
trading at exactly $400. It was as low as $377 on   the news today. Where did this news actually come 
from? Well, it comes from this tweet from a guy   called Josh Swihart. He says over the past few 
weeks, it has become clear that the majority of   the Bootstrap board members have moved into clear 
misalignment with the mission of Zcash. He says   yesterday, the entire Electric Coin Co. team left 
after being constructively discharged. In short,   the terms of our employment were changed in a 
way that it made it impossible for us to perform   our duties effectively and with integrity. We are 
founding a new company, but we are still remaining   with the same mission. Josh is the former CEO of 
Electric Coin Co. and today I am going to break   down for you whether this is an opportunity 
or whether this is just a whole lot of FUD. In order for you to understand that, you need 
to understand the history of Zcash. Zcash is   a proof of work network like Bitcoin except that 
it is private. It was created almost as a faster,   cheaper, and compliantly private version of 
Bitcoin. It was created by a bunch of founders   including a guy called Zooko. He created the 
Zcash protocol through a company called Electric   Coin Co. This was the founders' company set up to 
develop the Zcash protocol. Fast forward to today,   the Zcash protocol is running and has the support 
of big names. Naval Ravikant is a big supporter.   Arthur Hayes is a big supporter. Mert is a 
big supporter. The Winklevoss brothers are big   supporters. A lot of the old Bitcoin cypherpunk 
movement seem to have taken on this new challenge   of creating private money, which is where Bitcoin 
has basically failed us because Bitcoin is not   really private. It is anonymous because of 
addresses, but ultimately the on-chain sleuths   have tracked back lots of the transactions. 
Effectively, Zcash is private Bitcoin. Remember I said to you that this protocol was 
developed in this company called Electric Coin   Co. and it is a proof of work protocol. In 
a proof of stake protocol, the tokens are   pre-issued and given to investors. In a proof of 
work protocol, the tokens only get released every   time a block is mined. Similar to Bitcoin, the 
tokens don't exist until they are mined. With a   proof of stake protocol like Ethereum, tokens 
are held by the foundation and the foundation   sells those tokens to develop the protocol. With a 
proof of work protocol, you can't do that because   you don't have pre-mined tokens. So Zcash had this 
mechanism where 80% went to the miners, 5% went to   the foundation, and 7% went to Electric Coin Co. 
to carry on funding the development of wallets   and other applications. For the longest time, 
Zooko was part of Electric Coin Co., although   he did leave in December 2023 and he started a 
new company also building on the Zcash protocol. Here is where it gets messy. In November 2024, 
the system changed. The new change said that   of every block mined, 80% goes to the miners, 8% 
goes to the Zcash Community Grants (ZCG), and 12%   goes into a lockbox. A lockbox is exactly what it 
sounds like. Every block that is mined, the tokens   go into a box which is locked until they can agree 
what to do with the money. Originally, Electric   Coin Co. was getting 7% of every single block 
and now they are not getting anything. Where is   the money going? It is going into a lockbox. As of 
November 2024, there is no disbursement mechanism   currently defined. The Zcash community will need 
to decide upon a suitable decentralized mechanism   for permitting withdrawals. Now you are starting 
to see where the problem is. Electric Coin Co.,   which was building so many applications, all of 
a sudden is not automatically getting the money. The founder, Zooko, left Electric Coin Co. and 
Josh Swihart took over as CEO. He and a bunch   of developers decided to donate their shares 
to a nonprofit organization called Bootstrap.   Bootstrap is a nonprofit organization meant to 
hold the shares in Electric Coin Co. What seems   to have happened is that Bootstrap, operating 
under strict legal and fiduciary obligations,   had conflict with the team regarding 
external investment and an alternative   structure to privatize Zashi, the wallet. 
The team of developers basically said they   couldn't work under all these restrictions and 
they weren't getting paid or receiving grants   anyway. So they left. As Mert says, Zcash did 
not lose anything. The Electric Coin Co. team did   not like their board, so they started the exact 
same company with a different name and no board,   meaning they are now unburdened by 
the politics. This whole thing is a   nothing burger. They didn't like the board, they 
weren't getting money from the protocol anyway,   and they started a new company to carry 
on developing without the bureaucracy. The core devs are not gone. Electric Coin Co. is 
just one part of the Zcash development community.   There is Shielded Labs, the Zcash Foundation, and 
Project Techon. All of those remain independent.   Nothing has really changed. This would have been a 
massive concern if the Zcash developers were being   paid by the protocol and all of a sudden they 
lost their funding. They weren't getting funding   anyway. This is a retail dump based on headlines. 
We know that there are big names involved here,   like Tyler Winklevoss. He is retweeting messages 
saying no one from Zcash has quit and the team is   more aligned than ever. Tyler Winklevoss is highly 
incentivized for Zcash to work because he runs a   digital asset treasury company that buys Zcash. 
If you were responsible for millions of dollars   and your mission was Zcash, would you amplify a 
message that was bad for the protocol? It doesn't   make sense. Retail is waking up to these 
headlines and in a low liquidity market,   headlines can scare. But after hours of analysis 
and speaking to insiders, this Zcash thing is a   nothing burger. Nothing has changed except that 
the devs have moved from one structure where   there was a hostile board to another structure. 
If you were bullish before, nothing has changed. Let's talk about the other big news which 
can affect the markets tomorrow. Trump's   tariffs are on the line tomorrow 
because the Supreme Court could rule   as to whether the tariffs were legal or illegal. 
This is a complicated case because Trump charged   about $150 billion in tariffs. In financial 
year 2025, total tariffs were $216 billion,   but some were there before. The 
Supreme Court tomorrow may come   out with a ruling. There was skepticism from 
the justices during arguments in November. It   is possible we see a split decision where some 
tariffs are upheld and others struck down. The   argument comes down to whether or not Trump is 
allowed to increase tariffs without Congress's   approval. There is a law called IEEPA that gives 
the president certain powers in cases of economic   emergencies. It says the president may "regulate 
importation." Do those words mean tariffs?   Can the president impose tariffs even though 
the Constitution gives that power to Congress? Polymarket currently says there is a 24% chance 
they will rule in favor of Trump's tariffs,   meaning a 76% chance they will be deemed illegal. 
If they are illegal, will Trump have to pay the   $150 billion back? Who do you pay it back to? 
Importers who paid the tariffs are taking Trump   to court to try and get their money back. We may 
or may not hear the final answer tomorrow. Even   if they rule it unconstitutional, Trump may find 
another way to make them constitutional. Why are   we talking about this today? Because tomorrow is 
Friday and news on a Friday in low liquidity risks   a market overreaction. This whole story comes 
down to whether that revenue was earmarked for   stimulus checks. I don't think we will get a final 
answer tomorrow, but beware of low liquidity. All right, we have another winner in 
our Cast card competition. Remember,   a Cast card is a crypto debit card where you put 
crypto into a wallet and spend using a card linked   to an app. I am giving away pure gold ones on 
Fridays. Today's winner of $1,000 is Travis   Stewart. If you are Travis Stewart and you signed 
up, email giveaways@cryptobanter.com and we will   deposit $1,000 into your card. If you want to 
stand a chance to win, use the link below to   get your Cast card. I will see you guys again 
tomorrow. Until then, trade well, my friends.
